chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Mindquarry is a web-application that supports your teamwork by combining file sharing, Wiki for knowledge management and collaborative task management.
This user guide will introduce the most important features of the Mindquarry system.

chapter.title: Managing Teams with Mindquarry
chapter.para: With Mindquarry teams you can see your teams and team members. Team managers can invite members.

chapter.title: Managing Files with Mindquarry
chapter.para: Mindquarry file sharing stores all your documents and keeps a history of changes.
With Mindquarry file sharing you can synchronize shared files with your desktop, view shared files in the Mindquarry web application and see the history of changes made to your team's files.

section.title: Desktop Synchronization
section.para: There are various ways to access the files shared with your team using the Mindquarry Collaboration Server. This section explain the most common ways to access these files.

tip.title: How to access shared files
tip.para: The files shown in the file sharing browser are shared by all team members. In order to edit them and to share your changes, you need to synchronize the shared folder with your desktop. There are three ways to do this:

listitem.para: Using the Mindquarry Desktop Client. The Mindquarry Desktop Client requires Microsoft Windows and Java 5 and synchronizes all your teamspaces with the Mindquarry Collaboration Server automatically. To install the Mindquarry Desktop Client, click the Client link in the footer of this page.
Using the Subversion program. Mindquarry is fully Subversion compatible, meaning you can use any Subversion client like TortoiseSVN, SmartSVN or RapidSVN to synchronize your files.
Using WebDAV. You can use the builtin-WebDAV-support of your operating system to access the shared files and read and write them on the fly.

section.title: Mindquarry Desktop Client
section.para: The Mindquarry Desktop Client is installed via Java Webstart. When clicking the Synchronize now button in the workspace browser or the client link in the footer of the Mindquarry Web Application, your browser will download a small file that will install the Mindquarry Desktop Client on your computer and start it automatically. The general procedure is:

step.para: Java WebStart will start downloading your personalized Mindquarry Desktop Client and ask you for your username and password to access your personalized Mindquarry Desktop Client.
Once the client is downloaded, Java WebStart will launch the Client automatically.
In order to connect to your Mindquarry Collaboration Server, you need to enter your username and password to the Mindquarry Desktop client.

section.para: The Mindquarry Desktop client features a Synchronize button. Clicking this button the first time will download all shared files from the Mindquarry Collaboration Server that you can access to your desktop computer.

note.para: Depending on the size and number of shared files, this could take some time.

section.para: Whenever you click this synchronize button again, the Mindquarry Desktop Client will download all changed files from the Mindquarry Collaboration Server to your desktop computer and will upload all files modified or added on your desktop computer to the Mindquarry Collaboration Server, so they become accessible by other team members.

section.title: Subversion Support
section.para: Mindquarry's file sharing is 100% compatible to the open source version control system Subversion. You can use any Subversion client to synchronize your files. The relevant repository URL is http://your.mindquarryserver.com/repos/teamname/trunk/.

section.title: WebDAV Support
section.para: Mindquarry's file sharing is 100% compatible to the WebDAV file sharing protocol. You can use your operating systems capability to mount WebDAV folders to access the shared document at real-time. The relevant repository URL is http://your.mindquarryserver.com/repos/teamname/trunk/.

section.title: Shared Files
section.para:
The Mindquarry file sharing block includes a listing of all your teams. For each team you have the ability to browse files or view changed files
Convered in .

The file browser shows you the files in the base directory of your team's shared files, shows subdirectories and files. For each file there is information about file size, date of last modification, the author of the last modification and the comment the last author made when synchronizing her files.

You can expand subdirectories by clicking on the small plus-icon or browse into the subdirectory by clicking the directory name. When browsing a subdirectory, you will see a arrow pointing up allowing you to switch back to the parent directory.
An additional feature is the ability to see previous states of the shared files by clicking the left and right arrows on to to go back to an earlier (left) or later (right) stage.

section.title: History of Changes
section.para:
The history of changes allows you to keep track with your colleagues work. You will see what colleague changed what files at what point of time. As an additional feature, you can subscribe to the feed of changes using an feed reader
A feed reader will notify you when changes have been made to a file sharing directory you subscribed to. It allows you to stay informed without having to visit the history of changes page regularily. .

chapter.title: Sharing Ideas with Mindquarry
chapter.para: The Wiki is your personal idea-store, blackboard and glossary for sharing information and creativity.
Each team's wiki consists of a list of Wiki pages. You can see this list by clicking the All pages link at the bottom of each Wiki page.

section.title: Editing Wiki pages
section.para: In order to edit a Wiki page's content, you have to double-click the Wiki page. After editing or formatting the text, click the Save button to save your changes. If you would like to cancel the editing and revert the page to the original content, click the Cancel button.
In order to edit a Wiki page's title, double-click the title and click the Save button to save and share your changes. Use the Cancel button to cancel editing a title.

You can edit a Wiki page's title and content at once by clicking the Edit button. After clicking this button, the whole page becomes editable and you can use the Save button to save your changes and the Cancel button to revert the page to the original state.

section.title: Linking Wiki pages
section.para: In order to create links between two Wiki pages, you have to edit one Wiki page and turn a part of it's text content into a link. The general procedure is:

step.para: Start editing the page by clicking edit or double-clicking the page's content.
Highlight a word or phrase in the Wiki page editor.
Click the create link button in the toolbar.
Continue editing the page and save your changes.

section.para: Afterwards all the new link can be clicked and will lead you to the new page. If this page already exists, you will see it's contents. If it is a completely new page, you will be able to edit the page's contents right away.

tip.para: You can use the advanced link button in the toolbar if you would like to specify the target of the newly created link.

chapter.title: Managing Tasks with Mindquarry
chapter.para: With the task management block you can see your todo list and assign tasks to your team members.
